Html: I am using an AMD loader and would like to load datajs as a module.

Hi Arthur,

    This is something we would consider, thanks for the bringing this up. In the meantime you should be able to branch the code and make datajs use the define function if available.  For example, if you modify the datajs.js file in the source code and change it to this, and then rebuild: 

// Copyright (c) Microsoft.  All rights reserved.

// WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,  FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR
// COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE,
// ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.

// datajs.js

(function (window, undefined) {
    
    var datajs = window.datajs || {};
    var odatajs = window.datajs || {};

    // AMD support
    if (typeof define === 'function' && define.amd) {        
        define('datajs', datajs);
        define('odata', odata);
    } else {
        window.datajs = datajs;
        window.odata = odata; 
    }
    
    // INCLUDE: odata-utils.js
    // INCLUDE: odata-net.js
    // INCLUDE: odata-handler.js
    // INCLUDE: odata-xml.js
    // INCLUDE: odata-atom.js
    // INCLUDE: odata-metadata.js
    // INCLUDE: odata-json.js
    // INCLUDE: odata-batch.js
    // INCLUDE: odata.js

    // INCLUDE: store-dom.js
    // INCLUDE: store-indexeddb.js
    // INCLUDE: store-memory.js
    // INCLUDE: store.js

    // INCLUDE: deferred.js
    // INCLUDE: cache-source.js
    // INCLUDE: cache.js

})(this);

You should be able to use the datajs and odata variables as AMD modules instead of globals if the define function is available..

Regards,

Alex Trigo.
